div.div: κνημί̄ς , ῖδος (κνήμη): greave. The greaves were metal plates, lined with some soft material, bent around the shin-bone under the knee, and fastened by clasps at the ankle (see cut No. 36), thus only in the Iliad. In the Odyssey, Od. 24.229, the word signifies leather leggins.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
